title: HTTP
summary: The HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is the underlying network protocol that enables transfer of hypermedia documents on the Web, typically between a browser and a server so that humans can read them. The current version of the HTTP specification is called HTTP/2.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
